definition: abbr. for Ukraine 烏克蘭|乌克兰[Wu1 ke4 lan2]/surname Wu

sentences.english: Shortly after this slip, Escobar was shot and killed in what many people view as a related incident.
sentences.chinese: 很多人都认为他的死与这个乌龙球有关。

sentences.english: There has never been an own goal in the World Cup Final.
sentences.chinese: 世界杯决赛还从来没有出现过乌龙球。

sentences.english: You can't blame the referee for the own-goal at the end but the time?
sentences.chinese: 最后时刻的乌龙球你不能怪裁判，但是时间呢？

sentences.english: It is very unusual for three own goals to be scored in one match at international level.
sentences.chinese: 乌龙球“帽子戏法”在国际水平的赛事中极为罕见。

sentences.english: Forlan hit a brace for the visitors and Gilberto Siva netted an own goal.
sentences.chinese: 福兰为客队进球，吉尔贝托席尔瓦打进乌龙球。

sentences.english: That's probably why he holds the record for the most own goals against us.
sentences.chinese: 也许这正是他保持着我们乌龙球纪录的原因。

sentences.english: England won Paraguay 1 - 0 , for No 4's own goal of Paraguay.
sentences.chinese: 英格兰因为巴拉圭4号的乌龙球，最后以1比0获胜。

definition: to burst or force open a door/to excommunicate sb (from the Roman Catholic Church)/to score a goal (in football, hockey etc)
to equalize/to level the score/to pull back the advantage
corner kick (in soccer)/free strike in hockey
hat trick (when one player scores three goals)
(soccer, handball etc) to kick or shoot the ball towards the goal
(sports) to extend the duration of a game (due to stoppages)/(abbr. for 傷停補時|伤停补时[shang1 ting2 bu3 shi2]) injury time
to knock on the door/to take a shot on goal (sports)
